results.adx_keywords: your-feed-science;Vaccination and Immunization;Research;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Antibodies;Immune System
results.title: Feeling Terrible After Your Covid Shot? Then It’s Probably Working.
results.abstract: Fever, chills and fatigue may all be signs of vigorous antibody production, a new study finds.

media.caption: The new results suggest that people who have a rough time after vaccination are likely to gain stronger protection against the virus.

results.adx_keywords: Personal Finances;Banking and Financial Institutions;Stocks and Bonds;Frauds and Swindling
results.title: When Did Cashing Savings Bonds Become So Impossible?
results.abstract: Citing potential fraud, banks are making it increasingly difficult to pay out savings bonds. An unlikely beneficiary is the federal government.

results.adx_keywords: Law and Legislation;Politics and Government;Families and Family Life;Democratic Party;Republican Party;Iowa;Minnesota;Oregon;Missouri
results.byline: By Trip Gabriel and Hilary Swift
results.title: Two Families Got Fed Up With Their States’ Politics. So They Moved Out.
results.abstract: The Nobles of Iowa moved to blue Minnesota. The Huckinses of Oregon moved to red Missouri. Their separate journeys, five weeks apart, illustrate the fracturing of America.

media.copyright: Hilary Swift for The New York Times

results.title: Israel’s Worst Day at War
results.abstract: The shock waves of the Hamas attack on Israel will reach Iran, Saudi Arabia and Ukraine.

media.caption: Maxim Barkalifa stood on the roof of his neighbor’s house and surveys the damage to another neighbor’s house that was struck by a rocket fired from Gaza in Ashkelon, Israel, on Saturday.

results.title: Ready to Give Gravel Biking a Try? There’s No Time Like the Fall.
results.abstract: There are few better ways to revel in the blaze of autumn leaves than by cycling down out-of-the way dirt or gravel roads and paths. Here are five places to explore on two wheels.

media.caption: Northwest Arkansas, particularly the Bentonville area, is known for its stellar trails that appeal to both gravel and mountain cyclists.

results.title: The Remaking of The Wall Street Journal

results.adx_keywords: Gardens and Gardening;Flowers and Plants;Content Type: Service
results.title: Choosing a Houseplant? Durable Doesn’t Have to Mean Boring.
results.abstract: Rule No. 1: “You don’t have to just have a plain-Jane green plant.” But here’s what you do have to do — to find the right plant and maintain it.

media.caption: A startling twist on a familiar houseplant: a variegated form of foxtail asparagus fern (Asparagus densiflorus Myersii), with new foliage that starts out stark white. Karl Gercens, the conservatory manager at Longwood Gardens, searched for years before scoring a piece big enough to fill a four-inch pot.

results.title: Shades of Gray, and Then Some

results.title: More Brokerages Leave Powerful Realtor Group
results.abstract: Re/Max and Anywhere Real Estate, a brokerage franchiser, will no longer require agents to belong to the National Association of Realtors, as part of agreements to settle two class-action lawsuits.

media.caption: About 340,000 U.S. real estate agents, including those from Sotheby’s, will no longer be required to pay membership fees to a powerful real estate group after a legal settlement.
